com.artisan.incodeapi
Class ArtisanTrackingManager

java.lang.Object
  com.artisan.incodeapi.ArtisanTrackingManager

public class ArtisanTrackingManager
extends java.lang.Object

Manages in-code analytics tracking designed for use with Artisan. Use the provided static methods to track analytics events that you'd like to view in your Artisan analytics dashboard.

Method Detail

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track any custom events you'd like to view in your Artisan analytics dashboard.

For example:

ArtisanTrackingManager.trackEvent("Product Purchased");
NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan and also supply additional data. For instance, if you have a product page that you want to check, but you also want to be able to know which products are being viewed, you could track an event named "Viewed Product" and pass the product id as additional data.

For example:

Map<String, String> parameters = new HashMap<String, String>();
parameters.put("sku", "A0123456789");
parameters.put("product name", "Artisan Developer T-Shirt");
ArtisanTrackingManager.trackEvent("Product Purchased", parameters);
NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
parameters - An Map representing additional parameters (key/value pairs) associated with the event.

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.lang.String category)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan with a category. NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
category - A string representing an extra classification your would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Womens" or "Mens"

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                              java.lang.String category)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan and also supply additional data and a category. NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
parameters - An Map representing additional parameters (key/value pairs) associated with the event.
category - A string representing an extra classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Womens" or "Mens"

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.lang.String category,
                              java.lang.String subCategory)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan and also supply a category and sub category. NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
category - A string representing an extra classification your would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Womens" or "Mens"
subCategory - A string representing another classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Sweaters" or "Jackets".

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                              java.lang.String category,
                              java.lang.String subCategory)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan and also supply additional data, category, and sub category. NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
parameters - An Map representing additional parameters (key/value pairs) associated with the event.
category - A string representing an extra classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Womens" or "Mens"
subCategory - A string representing another classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Sweaters" or "Jackets".

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.lang.String category,
                              java.lang.String subCategory,
                              java.lang.String subSubCategory)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan and also category, sub category, and sub sub category. NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
category - A string representing an extra classification your would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Womens" or "Mens"
subCategory - A string representing another classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Sweaters" or "Jackets".
subSubCategory - A string representing a final classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Hoodies" or "Zip-ups".

trackEvent

public static void trackEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                              java.lang.String category,
                              java.lang.String subCategory,
                              java.lang.String subSubCategory)
Track an event with Artisan. Use this to track an event with Artisan and also supply additional data, category, sub category, and sub sub category. NOTE:If trackEvent is called before the Artisan Service is fully started, like in the onResume of the first Activity of your application, it is possible that the event will not be recorded. Anything after the onResume of the first Activity should work--Artisan will be fully started by then.

Parameters:
eventName - The name of the event you're tracking, e.g. "Purchased Product" or "Logged In".
parameters - An Map representing additional parameters (key/value pairs) associated with the event.
category - A string representing an extra classification your would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Womens" or "Mens"
subCategory - A string representing another classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Sweaters" or "Jackets".
subSubCategory - A string representing a final classification you would like to associate with this event. e.g. "Hoodies" or "Zip-ups".
